required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective, Multi-center, Single-arm Study to Assess the Safety of Retrieval of the Recovery G2 Filter.
clinical_study.official_title: The Bard® Recovery® Filter Registry (EVEREST) for Patients Who Are Candidates for an Optional (Retrievable) Inferior Vena Cava Filter That Undergo Placement of the Bard® Recovery® Filter.

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to assess the safety of retrieval of the Bard Recovery® G2® Filter System. The G2 filter is an FDA-cleared device for inferior vena caval interruption in patients with pulmonary thromboembolism.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month post filter retrieval or through 6 months following implantation
primary_outcome.description: Technical success for retrieval of the filter such that the entire filter is removed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Retrieval or through 6 months of implantation
primary_outcome.description: technical success without subsequent damage to the cava wall or other retrieval-related complications requiring intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events Through 30 Days Post Retrieval
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events occurring at the time of retrieval through 30 days post filter retrieval procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days post retrieval or 6 months following filter placement
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects experiencing filter migrations from the initial placement position of 2cm or more.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 months or at retrieval of the filter
secondary_outcome.description: occurrence of fracture assessed at retrieval by the Investigator (broken filter arms, legs, or other components)

arm_group.description: All subjects enrolled to the study are in this arm. All subjects receive a filter.

intervention.description: Retrieval of previously placed RECOVERY G2 IVC filter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient is at temporary , increased risk of pulmonary embolism requiring caval interruption
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient has implanted filter in the IVC or superior vena cava (SVC)
- The patient has a duplicated or left-sided IVC
- The patient has a known untreatable or uncontrollable malignancy
- The patient has severe spinal deformity
- The patient has a creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl
- The patient has a life expectancy of < 6 months

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Eleven Investigators at 11 sites enrolled a total of 100 study subjects between December 7, 2005 and July 24, 2006.

group.title: Participants Receiving a Filter
group.description: Patients who were at temporary, increased risk of pulmonary embolism requiring inferior vena cava (IVC) interruption, and for whom Recovery G2 Filter retrieval could reasonably be expected to occur within 6 months of device placement.

measure.title: Indication for Placement
measure.description: Patients with active thromboembolic disease (the presence of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) or pulmonary embolism (PE) within 3 months of study enrollment).

outcome.title: Technical Success (Retrieval)
outcome.description: Technical success for retrieval of the filter such that the entire filter is removed.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month post filter retrieval or through 6 months following implantation
outcome.population: 61 of 100 patients enrolled underwent filter retrieval during the study.

measure.title: Technical Success (Retrieval)
measure.description: Technical success for retrieval of the filter such that the entire filter is removed.
measure.population: 61 of 100 patients enrolled underwent filter retrieval during the study.

outcome.title: Clinical Success (Retrieval)
outcome.description: technical success without subsequent damage to the cava wall or other retrieval-related complications requiring intervention.
outcome.time_frame: Time of Retrieval or through 6 months of implantation
outcome.population: 61/100 patients experienced filter retrieval during the study

measure.title: Clinical Success (Retrieval)
measure.description: technical success without subsequent damage to the cava wall or other retrieval-related complications requiring intervention.
measure.population: 61/100 patients experienced filter retrieval during the study

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events Through 30 Days Post Retrieval
outcome.description: Adverse events occurring at the time of retrieval through 30 days post filter retrieval procedure
outcome.population: 61 of 100 patients underwent filter retrieval during the study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events Through 30 Days Post Retrieval
measure.description: Adverse events occurring at the time of retrieval through 30 days post filter retrieval procedure
measure.population: 61 of 100 patients underwent filter retrieval during the study.

outcome.title: Filter Migration > 2cm
outcome.description: Percentage of subjects experiencing filter migrations from the initial placement position of 2cm or more.
outcome.time_frame: 30 days post retrieval or 6 months following filter placement
outcome.population: Migration measurement made for 58 retrieved subjects, 22 non-retrieved subjects reaching the 6 month visit, and 2 non-retrieved subjects with attempted retrievals and imaging.

measure.title: Filter Migration > 2cm
measure.description: Percentage of subjects experiencing filter migrations from the initial placement position of 2cm or more.
measure.population: Migration measurement made for 58 retrieved subjects, 22 non-retrieved subjects reaching the 6 month visit, and 2 non-retrieved subjects with attempted retrievals and imaging.

outcome.title: Incidence of Filter Fracture
outcome.description: occurrence of fracture assessed at retrieval by the Investigator (broken filter arms, legs, or other components)
outcome.time_frame: at 6 months or at retrieval of the filter
outcome.population: adequate imaging was available to assess filter integrity in 83 of the 100 participants.

group.title: Fractured Filters
group.description: retrieval of the filter such that the entire filter is retrieved

measure.title: Incidence of Filter Fracture
measure.description: occurrence of fracture assessed at retrieval by the Investigator (broken filter arms, legs, or other components)
measure.population: adequate imaging was available to assess filter integrity in 83 of the 100 participants.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: John Reviere, Director of Clinical Affairs
